channel.title: Enviromental Variables
channel.description:
Can anyone tell me the default variable for 'Path' or the variable I need to play servers.... Everytime I open like run.bat it says 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
Help ?![br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 03, 2009, 03:01:38 pm[/size][hr]I just set my enviromental variables to what it says in the sticky from The Soul and it still doesnt work. It just says: ''java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .'
Anyone..?

item.title: Enviromental Variables
item.dc:creator: @Sblasko9 Sblasko9
item.description:
@Sblasko9 wrote:

[quote=“wtfry, post:1, topic:282054”]Go to your environmental variables and under System Variables find
CLASSPATH
Then click edit on CLASSPATH and insert- CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

(Change the JDK to what ever JDK you have, to find out what your JDK is, go to “My Computer” Click “Local Disk (C:)” next go to “Program Files” then find “Java” click Java and inside it should tell you what JDK you have)

Again when you are in Enviromental Variables and under System Variables still find
Path or PATH
Then click edit on Path or PATH and insert- C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;
(Again change the JDK to whatever JDK you have)[/quote]

THANK YOU!!!

Read full topic
